alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 8:23PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carbon and southwestern Albany Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 823 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Six Mile Campground, or 50 miles southwest of Laramie, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Six Mile Campground, Skyline, Evans Creek Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Lake Owen Campground, Boswell Creek Campground, Illinois Creek Campground, Woods Landing, Miller Lake Campground, Lake Owen and Bobbie Thompson Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
